timeline.bodyText:
I 'd argue it needs to have the word "scoreDRL" in the message, because that is the breadcrumb that ties back into the solverConfig's <scoreDRL> line.
It's also important for us when we get support tickets, to know that they went through scoreDrl and not though kmodule.xml or CS.
timeline.author: ge0ffrey

replies.bodyText:
This code will only be used when they go through scoreDrl/scoreDrlFile.
In fact, I'd argue that saying "DRL" is better than saying "scoreDrl or scoreDrlFile".
replies.author: triceo
